name: NCPIFHIRImplementationGuide
title: NCPI FHIR Implementation Guide
description: FHIR Implementation Guide for the NIH Cloud Platform Interoperability Effort (NCPI).

extension.valueMarkdown: Automatically added as a dependency - all IGs depend on HL7 Terminology
Automatically added as a dependency - all IGs depend on the HL7 Extension Pack

resource.name: DRS Attachment
resource.description: A FHIR Attachment with a DRS url.

resource.name: DRS Document Reference
resource.description: A FHIR Document Reference with an embedded DRS URI. See https://github.com/ga4gh/data-repository-service-schemas.

resource.name: NCPI Disease
resource.description: Representation for a disease under study for a given research dataset.

resource.name: NCPI Family Relationship
resource.description: Representation of a family relationship.

resource.name: NCPI Research Study
resource.description: The NCPI Research Study is based upon the core FHIR ResearchStudy resource and shall act as the umbrella under which all study resources can ultimately be found. For the purposes of interoperability, some restrictions have been made to enforce a common mechanism for describing enrollment and provide a simple means for summarizing subject count and consent group membership.

resource.name: NCPI Phenotype
resource.description: Representation of phenotypic observations (present or absent)

resource.name: Raw Data Observation
resource.description: Representation for a row of data from one of the dataset's tables.

resource.name: Research Document Reference
resource.description: A FHIR Document Reference created by an analysis task. Context.related = Task

resource.name: Research Task
resource.description: A FHIR analysis task that takes at least one specimen as input and produces at least one document.

resource.name: NCPI Data Dictionary Harmony
resource.description: Based on the FHIR resource type, ConceptMap, the StudyDataDictionaryHarmony resource provides insight into the transformations made during the ETL from source data into FHIR allowing clients to use the $translate function to discover all of the public codes that were mapped from one of the study's actual vocabulary.

resource.name: NCPI Study Data Dictionary Data Table
resource.description: Aggregates Variable Details associated with a single dataset table that are represented in FHIR as as list of references to StudyDataDictionaryVariables in the *observationResultRequirement* property.

resource.name: NCPI Study Data Dictionary Data Variable
resource.description: FHIR profile used to describe single variable from the dataset. This resource should be as complete as possible including details such as *description*, *data-type*, *permitted enumerations*, *quantity units*, etc.

resource.name: NCPI Study Group
resource.description: Grouping subject participation within a research study is helpful to provide definitive lists of participants that fit a specific criteria such as *All Participants* or *Participants From a Particular Consent Group*, etc.

resource.name: Study Summary
resource.description: An observation containing summary information about a study in it's entirety or one of it's subpopulations.

resource.name: Study Variable Summary
resource.description: An observation containing summary data associated with research data from FHIR.

resource.name: Supporting Information
resource.description: Additional information relevant to interpreting/understanding the report.

resource.name: Condition Inheritance Pattern
resource.description: Value Set for specific ttransmission patterns of a condition in a pedigree

resource.name: Disease Codes
resource.description: This value set includes all codes from this FHIR server's representation of OMIM, Mondo and NICt CodeSystems.

resource.name: Case/Control Vars for 'status' categoricals
resource.description: Example ValueSet listing all possible 'values' from the Case/Control variable.

resource.name: Harmonized ValueSet for data table
resource.description:
Public codes mapped from example dataset

The codes used below were chosen purely for example's sake and are in no way an endorsement or suggestion for terms that should be used in a real data-dictionary.

resource.description: Example Data Table with 4 variables

resource.description: Codes that would apply to NCPI projects

resource.description: This value set includes all codes from Human Phenotype Ontology.

resource.name: tbd-codes
resource.description: This value set includes all TBD Codes

resource.name: Condition Inheritance Pattern
resource.description: A set of terms that describe the transmission pattern of a condition in a pedigree.

resource.name: Dataset CodeSystem (lists all tables)
resource.description: Example CodeSystem for a data-dictionary dataset with only 1 table.

resource.name: Datatable CodeSystem (lists all variables)
resource.description: Example CodeSystem for a data-dictionary table with 4 variables represented as codes.

resource.name: Human Phenotype Ontology
resource.description: The Human Phenotype Ontology (HPO) provides a standardized vocabulary of phenotypic abnormalities encountered in human disease. Please see license of HPO at http://www.human-phenotype-ontology.org

resource.name: Human Genome Variation Society nomenclature
resource.description:
HGVS nomenclatures are the guidelines for mutation nomenclature made by the Human Genome Variation Society.

HGVS nomenclature can be used with the HL7 coded data type (code data type that accepts expression data, or a coded expression data type). This coded data type should be able to distinguish expressions in HGVS nomenclature from coded concepts. For example, in the HL7 messages specified according to the HL7 V2 Clinical Genomics Fully LOINC-Qualified Genetic Variation Model, HGVS nomenclature can be used to as the observation values for DNA sequence variations. For example, OBX|1|CWE|48004-6^DNA Sequence Variation^LN||c.1129C>T^^HGVS|

Versioning information: The HGVS nomenclature for the description of sequence variants was last modified Feb 20, 2008. The HGVS nomenclature for the description of protein sequence variants was last modified May 12, 2007. The HGVS nomenclature for the description of DNA sequence variants was last modified June 15, 2007 The HGVS nomenclature for the description of RNA sequence variants was last modified May 12, 2007

HGVS nomenclatures can be used freely by the public.

resource.name: LOINC Answers
resource.description: LOINC ANSWERS used by NCPI resources

resource.name: Mondo Disease Ontology
resource.description: The Mondo Disease Ontology (Mondo) aims to harmonize disease definitions across the world. The name Mondo comes from the latin word 'mundus' and means 'for the world.'

resource.name: NCI Thesaurus
resource.description: NCI Thesaurus (NCIt) provides reference terminology for many NCI and other systems. It covers vocabulary for clinical care, translational and basic research, and public information and administrative activities.

resource.name: NCPI FHIR Codes
resource.description: Codes that would apply to NCPI projects

resource.description: Data Types for NCPI Research

resource.name: ToBeDeterminedCodes ('TbdCodes')
resource.description: These codes are currently 'TBD-LOINC' codes. The CG WG is requesting formal LOINC codes.
